00100 #define STRNCPY(dst,src,n)      { strncpy(dst,src,n-1); dst[n-1] = 0; }
00101 
00102 #ifndef MIN
00103 #define MIN(x,y)                (((x) < (y)) ? (x) : (y))
00104 #endif
00105 
00106 #ifndef MAX
00107 #define MAX(x,y)                (((x) > (y)) ? (x) : (y))
00108 #endif
00109 
00110 /* timeval macros */
00111 #ifndef timerisset
00112 #define timerisset(tvp)\
00113          ((tvp)->tv_sec || (tvp)->tv_usec)
00114 #endif
00115 #ifndef timercmp
00116 #define timercmp(tvp, uvp, cmp)\
00117         ((tvp)->tv_sec cmp (uvp)->tv_sec ||\
00118         (tvp)->tv_sec == (uvp)->tv_sec &&\
00119         (tvp)->tv_usec cmp (uvp)->tv_usec)
00120 #endif
00121 #ifndef timerclear
00122 #define timerclear(tvp)\
00123         ((tvp)->tv_sec = (tvp)->tv_usec = 0)
00124 #endif
00125 
00126 /* If configure does not define the endianess, try
00127    to find it out */
00128 #if !defined(L_ENDIAN) && !defined(B_ENDIAN)
00129 #if __BYTE_ORDER == __LITTLE_ENDIAN
00130 #define L_ENDIAN
00131 #elif __BYTE_ORDER == __BIG_ENDIAN
00132 #define B_ENDIAN
00133 #else
00134 #error Unknown endianness. Edit rdesktop.h.
00135 #endif
00136 #endif /* B_ENDIAN, L_ENDIAN from configure */
00137 
00138 /* No need for alignment on x86 and amd64 */
00139 #if !defined(NEED_ALIGN)
00140 #if !(defined(__x86__) || defined(__x86_64__) || \
00141       defined(__AMD64__) || defined(_M_IX86) || \
00142       defined(__i386__))
00143 #define NEED_ALIGN
00144 #endif
00145 #endif
